reporter_caption.center: STATE EX REL. D.B. v. OSWALT, 129 Ohio St.3d 1498 (2011)

caption.center: State ex rel. D.B. v. Oswalt.

opinion.opinion_text:
MOTION AND PROCEDURAL RULING This cause originated in this court on the filing of a complaint for a writ of mandamus and prohibition.
Upon consideration of relator's motion for leave to redact portions of Exhibit A to the complaint, it is ordered by the court that the motion is granted. Counsel for relator shall come to the Supreme Court of Ohio Clerk's office and redact all personal identifiers, as defined by Rule 44(H) of the Rules of Superintendence for the Courts of Ohio and Rule 8.6 of the Supreme Court of Ohio Rules of Practice, within ten days of the date of this entry.
